Project information

  • Category: Video Coding
  • Client: Dr. Tew Yi Qi
  • Project date: 23/05/2023
  • Project URL: https://lnt.tf.fau.de/harp/index.php

Project Description

This project is about exploring and building an executable, testable and possibly efficient prototype based on the latest video codec standard, which is High Efficiency Video Coding, HEVC/H.265 within an open-source toolkit, HEVC Analyzer For Rapid Prototyping (HARP). While VVC/H.266 is not yet available in the market for practical utilization as its investigation and implementation have not reached a stable phase, this project will concentrate on using the existing HEVC/H.265 HARP to make any possible or necessary alterations on its codebase. This is why the project is building upon the foundation of the latest video codec standard to construct an own version of, perhaps more versatile and efficient encoding standard, specifically the VVC/H.266 within the HARP. This can be achieved by seeking and ascertaining the possibility of replacing existing HEVC/H.265 HARP with a modified structure of the codec that supports the VVC/H.266 standard as an attempt to attain the support of higher video resolutions, temporarily but chiefly measured in terms of executability, efficiency and anticipation for the quality achievement also during present pace of investigation and development.

Chuah Shee Yeap
